For one of the richest and most powerful nations in the world to allow this to continue is nothing less than shameful. 

We must take action to reign in these inflated prices. 

For Angela Civiletti and 30 million others, it is a matter of life and death.

Over the past two decades, the cost of prescription diabetes drugs like Insulin have skyrocketed. Studies show that manufacturers could charge $7-$11 per month for insulin and still make a profit ‚Äì yet prices for these drugs continue to rise to over $450 per month.

This is Angela Civiletti. She lives in Rochester and she has Type I diabetes. 

Today, she spoke about the constant fear she lives in, wondering how she might cover the exorbitant cost of the Insulin medicine she needs to stay alive. pic.twitter.com/KjzfgGE1Yo

The results were staggering.

The cost of diabetes medication in #NY25 is up to 21 times higher than in other countries like Canada, the UK, and Australia.

We must reign in these artificially inflated costs that place a significant and dangerous burden on our families.

I continue to hear from constituents whose number one concern is the outrageous cost of healthcare in America. That's why today I joined advocates to condemn the staggering results of a recent study I requested on the cost of prescription diabetes medication like Insulin. pic.twitter.com/SwXlKM1kq7
